document_title: Dangerous neurological diseases: Causes and symptoms
subsection_content:
When you discover that you have one or more symptoms of the disease, such as numbness in your hands/feet, muscle pain, dizziness, headaches, frequent loss of balance... you need to go to the hospital for examination immediately. .
The doctor will conduct a general examination for you, check nerve function to determine whether the nerves are damaged, how fast or slow reflexes are when receiving signals from the brain... The doctor will also ask about your medical history. your family, see if you have relatives with neurological diseases, and find out your living habits: are you exposed to polluted air, smoking or alcohol abuse.
MRI scans help detect abnormal signs inside the body and can find the cause of neurological diseases.
After a general examination, depending on your condition, the doctor may prescribe paraclinical tests such as: EEG, ultrasound, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), computed tomography (CT) ), Electromyography, etc. to coordinate accurate diagnosis of the cause and have effective, targeted treatment solutions.
